dict.string: Artichoke - Globe
artichoke-globe
Asteraceae
Perennial, Vegetable
1.2-1.8m Tall; Leaves 20-32cm long, 50-82cm wide; Edible bud 5-15cm diameter

Plant the seed or seedling 1 cm in soil. Plant 12cm deep. Best planted on well-drained soils. Little Fruit produced in first year of production. Optimal Soil: Loamy. Optimal Sun: Part sun to full sun.

Plant indoors for 6 weeks then transplate in spring after last frost. Make sure soil remains moist and well-drained. Regular watering. Cover with green compost and mulch to get through winter. After fisrt year cut down to 15cm and cover in straw to protect during winter. More yield in second harvest.

10 weeks to maturity with 8 weeks of harvest time once plant is matured. After seedling have their first six leaves, prune the plant to above the second set. The best time to harvest is when the plant starts to bud (before the flower blooms). Pinch the plant and remove for productive regrowth.

Best method of storing basil is freezing. This will prevent plant from losing its flavour. To quick-freeze basil, dry whole sprigs of basil and package in airtight plastic bags. Perfect for making pesto.
Tomatoes, calendula and broccoli. Does not go well with blueberries.
Artichoke - Jerusalem
artichoke-jerusalem
Asteraceae
Perennial, Tuber
1.5-3m Tall; Leaves up to 30cm long; Yellow flower 5-10cm diameter; Edible tuber 7.5-10cm long, 3.5cm thick

Plant the tuber 12cm deep. Best planted on well-drained soils. Little Fruit produced in first year of production. Optimal Soil: Mostly sandy to mostly clay, most soil types. Optimal Sun: Sun to full sun.

Plant indoors for 6 weeks then transplate in spring after last frost. Make sure soil remains moist and well-drained. Regular watering. Cover with green compost and mulch to get through winter. Watering, dry to moist.

Best method of storing basil is freezing. This will prevent plant from losing its flavour. To quick-freeze basil, dry whole sprigs of basil and package in airtight plastic bags. Perfect for making pesto.

Basil
basil
Lamiaceae
Annual or Biennials (depending on species), Herb
30-50cm Tall; Leaves 3-11cm long, 1-6 cm wide
POutdoor location to get 6-8 hours full sun daily. Soil to be moist and well-drained. Plant the seed or seedling one cm in soil. Optimal Soil: Loamy. Optimal Sun: Sun to full sun.
Plant indoors for 6 weeks then transplate in spring after last frost. Make sure soil remains moist and well-drained. Regular watering.

Best method of storing basil is freezing. This will prevent plant from losing its flavour. To quick-freeze basil, dry whole sprigs of basil and package in airtight plastic bags. Perfect for making pesto.
